Articles.Content:
Right!

This is a challenge to see who can do the most stuff with their rocket! As in, how many singular 'missions' can you pack into one flight?

Missions:

-Launching a satellite into a stable Kerbin orbit (10 points)

-Launching a reasonably-sized space station into a stable Kerbin orbit (20 points)

-Launching a satellite into a stable Mun orbit (30 points)

-Launching a reasonably-sized space station into a stable Mun orbit (40 points)

-Landing on the Mun (50 points)

-Returning to Kerbin safely (60 points)

Those are your goals. What I want to see you do is get as many points as possible.

Every time you accomplish a mission, you get the corresponding number of points. For example, any satellite in a stable Kerbin orbit will net you ten points apiece!

Mun landings are worth fifty points apiece, so try to go for multiple landings!

Rules:

-The usage of any balanced mod pack is allowed. CFG edits are strictly banned.

-You must document your flight, otherwise it may not be counted. A video recording of the entire mission is allowed, but if you do not have the capability to do so, screenshots at points of interest are acceptable. Make sure you get every point of interest, though!

-You\'ll have to tally points yourself. No fudging the numbers.

-Extra points may be awarded for outstanding creativity, by the judge [me], or whenever I feel like it.

-Presentation is everything! A good presentation makes me want to give out points like presents on Christmas!

-There will be a 'Top Three' for scoring.

Top Three

1: Shedao, 2760 points!

2: Smoke, 1130 points + 10 Awesomeness Points

3: 707-Engineering, 230 points + 10 Presentation Points.

Godspeed, gentlemen!
Multiple mun landings on a single flight?

Multiple mun landings on a single flight?

If you can manage it!

50 points is a lot.
I think I can do this quite reliably. Four satellites taped to a normal mun rocket, deploy two in parking orbit and two in munar orbit.

I think I can do this quite reliably. Four satellites taped to a normal mun rocket, deploy two in parking orbit and two in munar orbit.

If you can put all four in Munar orbit, it\'s lots more points...

I think I can do this quite reliably. Four satellites taped to a normal mun rocket, deploy two in parking orbit and two in munar orbit.

But that\'s only worth 80 points...oh well it\'s a start.

So two satellites in a Munar orbit are worth 60 points but a space station up there only 40 points?

Are there any rules for the satellite orbits? For example that they have to differ more than 100km or something else, so you can\'t drop them all on the same orbit.

Challenge accepted, challenge completed.

Used C7 and Probodyne

Challenge accepted, challenge completed.

Used C7 and Probodyne

C7 violates the \'balanced mods\' rule. Ask Tim_Barrett.

Challenge accepted, challenge completed.

Used C7 and Probodyne

The pack is balanced for in-atmosphere use, and should not be considered balanced in terms of space-flight.

Also, someone left 2 syllables out of Probodobodyne...

The pack is balanced for in-atmosphere use, and should not be considered balanced in terms of space-flight.

Also, someone left 2 syllables out of Probodobodyne...

Your splitting hairs that need not be split.

The challenges are all out of atmosphere.
I got close to 210 points, but unfortunately I was unable to obtain a stable orbit.

I got close to 210 points, but unfortunately I was unable to obtain a stable orbit.

Good Gravy, man!

I got close to 210 points, but unfortunately I was unable to obtain a stable orbit.

At 180 points you might have been successful.
I honestly surprise myself that I can regularly type Probodobodyne without making a mistake =p

I honestly surprise myself that I can regularly type Probodobodyne without making a mistake =p

Didnt it used to be Probodobobdyne?

Or was that your typing mistake?
Do you count wet workshops?

Your splitting hairs that need not be split.

The challenges are all out of atmosphere.

I was agreeing with you...
My poor mod pack, you are so mis-understood. *sniffle* The parts are balanced for in atmosphere. Not my fault jet engines work in Spaaaccceeeee. Neat contest by the way.

Thy three kerbonaughts climbed upon the majestic piece of junk vessel for their mission was certain, deploy thy 4 kerbalvision satellites around the mÃ¼n, land on thy mÃ¼n, and watch thy television...

Slowly the giant rose, losing limb as altitude was obtained, and as thy orbit of celestial kerbin was managed, the kerbals awaited, for 3 days.

As thy time came, the transition orbit was made, and reduced to a simple orbit..

4 satellites where launched.

As the ship tipped and trembled upon thy course, the brave kerbonaught smiled, while the others screamed their joy.

the landing was soft, re-orbit came soon, charging and barging towards thy devine kerbin, to watch thy favourite progams on time.

Alas, on this wonderous machine, no parachute had been put, management had cut costs, but at what cost?

and with thy luck and strenght Jeb pulled on his stick, all levers down, the alarms screaming and the red lights blinking, to an almost safe landing.

After mission report: 4 satellites on MÃ¼n orbit, one MÃ¼n landing, one safe return = 230 points.. Bill and Bob\'s mouth operation to repair their mouth muscles: priceless

Edit: scratch that 230 .. oups?

And how much is landing a station base on the Mun?

(Launch vehicle and landing system fully vanilla, that tank part not used)

I was agreeing with you...

You were also exploring details that didn\'t need to be explored. The fact that its balanced in atmosphere was irrelavent.

That you were agreeing with me is agreeable.

Doing all those things at the same time is actually hard... So i\'m just launching some satellites. (using Novaunch Repack. craft file is attached)

Just after takeof

Pushing hard to to get into orbit

Time for TMI

On the way...

.. for a crash landing

Got into an orbit and had some fuel left. Better bring more stuff next time.

Deploying satellites: 6...

12...

some more...

more...

the kluster is deployed!

Got back with enough fuel for a point landing.

Aiming really hard.

Close enough!

Imgur album: http://imgur.com/a/VDNee#12
Thats...1130 points. That\'s well over everyone else\'s entries put together.

So lemme get this straight, just peppering the Mun sky with sats (or stations, which I\'d prefer) is going to be enough? No need to, say, put them into different orbits?

Gimme a sec...
